data.Description: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments/structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with a unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

data.Name: Sales Order ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order. ID
data.Description: The unique identifier for the sales order. Typically auto-generated by the system.

data.Name: Sales Order Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order. Sales Order Number. Code
data.Description: The number of the sales order. This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.

data.Name: Fiscal Period
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order. Fiscal Year. ADC_ Fiscal Period
data.Description: Accounting period in which the Sales_Order_Date occurs. The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD in ISO 8601-1. Shall match the Fiscal_Year in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

data.Name: Sales Order Type Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order. Sales Order Name
data.Description: The name of the order in sales activities. The types of sales orders are usually allocated by users of the system according to different business needs; for example, some enterprises will be configured as non-contract orders, trial orders, factory orders and store orders.

data.Name: Sales Order Date
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order. Order Date
data.Description: The date of signing the sales order. It is the effective date of the sales order, not the system created date. The sales order of a certain period is counted based on the effective date.

data.Name: Sales Organization Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order. Sales Organization. ADC_ Business Segment
data.Description: The unique code of the sales organization which signed the order. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

data.Name: Salesperson ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order. Salesperson. ADC_ Employee
data.Description: The unique identifier for the salesperson. Shall match the Employee_ID in the BAS_Employee table.

data.Name: Customer Account ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order. Receiving. ADC_ Customer
data.Description: The unique identifier for the receiving customer. Typically autogenerated by the system. Shall match the Customer_Account_ID in the BAS_Customer table.

data.Name: Settlement Method Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order. Settlement Method. ADC_ Settlement Method
data.Description: The code of the settlement method. Various methods can be used to settle transactions and transfer money; for example, check, wire transfer and cash. Shall match the Settlement_Method_Code in the BAS_Settlement_Method table.

data.Name: Payment Term Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order. Payment Term. ADC_ Payment Term
data.Description: The code of the payment term. Shall match the Payment_Term_Code in the BAS_Payment_Term table; for example, cash on delivery, payment 30 days after delivery date.

data.Name: Order Transaction Amount
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order. Order. ADC_ Transaction Currency Amount
data.Description: The sales monetary amount recorded in transaction currency.

data.Name: Activity Records
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order. Recorded. ADC_ Activity Records
data.Description: The operation records on this record such as create, approve, last modify this record.
data.XBRLGL: Use corresponding element of XBRL GL taxonomy.

data.Name: Status
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order. Status
data.Description: The status of the sales order. EXAMPLE The order has been shipped (goods on the way), the order has been collected, and the order has been completed.

data.Name: Remark
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order. Remark
data.Description: Freeform text description.

data.Name: Business Segment X
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order. X. ADC_ Business Segment
data.Description: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments/structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with a unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

data.Name: Sales Order Line
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order Line. Definrd. ADC_ Sales Order Line
data.Description: Line item details for sales orders are contained in Table 78. Each line includes product, quantity, due date, price per unit, trading amount and settlement organization. The file will record for each sales order line item. Multiple types of products may be presented in one sales order. Additionally, different shippers and settlement organization may be assigned by each order line.

data.Name: Sales Order ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order Line. Detail to Summary. ADC_ Sales Order
data.Description: The unique identifier for the sales order. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Sales_Order_ID in the SAL_Orders table.
data.XBRLGL: gl-cor:documentReference  / Rather than use a data field, use XML's ID and IDREF to create the physical link from detail to summary structure.

data.Name: Sales Order Line ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order Line. ID
data.Description: The unique identifier for a sales order line. Typically auto-generated by the system.
data.XBRLGL: gl-cor:lineNumber / Rather than using a data field, use XML's ID at the top level of the structure. You can use both XML IDs and IDREFs to create physical links between related documents.

data.Name: Sales Order Line Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order Line. Line Number. Code
data.Description: The line number of the sales order. This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.
data.XBRLGL: gl-cor:lineNumber / Rather than using a data field, use XML's ID at the top level of the structure. You can use both XML IDs and IDREFs to create physical links between related documents.

data.Name: Sales Contract ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order Line. Detail to Summary. ADC_ Sales Contract
data.Description: The unique identifier for the sales contract. Typically auto-generated by the system. May be set to NULL if there is no sales contract. Otherwise shall match the Sales_Contract_ID in the SAL_Contracts_Details table.
data.XBRLGL: gl-cor:documentReference  / Rather than use a data field, use XML's ID and IDREF to create the physical link from detail to summary structure.

data.Name: Sales Contract Line ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order Line. Corresponding. ADC_ Sales Contract Line
data.Description: The unique identifier for a sales contract line. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Sales_Contract_Line_ID in the SAL_Contracts_Details table.
data.XBRLGL: gl-cor:lineNumber / Rather than using a data field, use XML's ID at the top level of the structure. You can use both XML IDs and IDREFs to create physical links between related documents.

data.Name: Payer ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order Line. Payer. ADC_ User
data.Description: The unique identifier for the payer. Typically auto-generated by the system. There are different purchase models in the group company; for example, centralized purchase, decentralized payment, decentralization of procurement and centralized payment. If the sales order customer adopts the centralized purchasing model, the customer may be a group company, and the settlement organization may be a subsidiary company of the group company. The customer name and the name of the payment customer may be different.
data.XBRLGL: Use corresponding element of XBRL GL taxonomy.

data.Name: Settlement Organization Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order Line. Settlement Organization. ADC_ Business Segment
data.Description: The unique code of the settlement organization. Both parties have settlement unit code, which is used to identify an organization for sales order settlement. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

data.Name: Dispatch Organization Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order Line. Dispatch Organization. ADC_ Business Segment
data.Description: The unique code of the dispatch organization. The dispatch unit refers to the unit who sends out goods unit belonging to the seller. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

data.Name: Due Date
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order Line. Due. Date
data.Description: The last requested delivery of products. When an order is delivered in multiple batches, this field refers to the time for the delivery of the last batch.

data.Name: Basic UOM Quantity
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order Line. Basic Unit Of Measure Quantity. ADC_ Measurement Unit
data.Description: The quantity by basic measurement unit.

data.Name: Sales Order Line Quantity
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order Line. Quantity. ADC_ Measurement Quantity
data.Description: The quantity of the sales order line by the measurement unit in sales order line.

data.Name: Tax Exclude Unit Price
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order Line. Tax Exclude Unit Price. Amount
data.Description: The unit price (excluding tax) in transaction currency.

data.Name: Tax Include Unit Price
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order Line. Tax Include Unit Price. Amount
data.Description: The unit price (including tax) in transaction currency.

data.Name: Tax Exclude Amount
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order Line. Tax Exclude. ADC_ Transaction Currency Amount
data.Description: The amount (excluding tax) in transaction currency.

data.Name: Tax Include Amount
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order Line. Tax Include. ADC_ Transaction Currency Amount
data.Description: The amount (including tax) in transaction currency.

data.Name: Transaction Tax N
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order Line. Charged. ADC_ Transaction TaxN
data.Description: The amount of Tax included in the transaction. Recorded in transaction currency.
data.XBRLGL: Use corresponding element of XBRL GL taxonomy.

data.Name: Product ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order Line. Corresponding. ADC_ Product
data.Description: The unique identifier for the sales product. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Inventory_Product_ID in the INV_Product table.

data.Name: Order Line Transaction Amount
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order Line. Amount. ADC_ Transaction Currency Amount
data.Description: The transaction currency amount of sales order line.

data.Name: Status
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order Line. Status
data.Description: The status of the document line. EXAMPLE New, save, submit and frozen.

data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Sales Order Line. X. ADC_ Business Segment
data.Description: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments/structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. data.Name: Invoice ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Generated. ID
data.Description: The unique identifier for the invoice. Typically auto-generated by the system. The same ID shall be used for all tables with invoice data.
data.XBRLGL: gl-cor:documentReference / Rather than using a data field, use XML's ID at the top level of the structure. You can use both XML IDs and IDREFs to create physical links between related documents.

data.Name: Invoice Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Generated. Invoice Number. Code
data.Description: The number of the internally generated invoice. The number is usually generated by manual input or is system generated; for example, including serial number, document type and date.

data.Name: Fiscal Period
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Generated. Fiscal Year. ADC_ Fiscal Period
data.Description: Accounting period in which the Invoice_Date occurs. The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD in ISO 8601-1. Shall match the Fiscal_Year in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

data.Name: Official Invoice Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Generated. Official_ Invoice Code
data.Description: The unique official code of the invoice, which is usually generated by the tax authorities.

data.Name: Invoice Type Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Generated. Invoice Type. Name
data.Description: The name of the invoice type. The documents are classified according to business content.

data.Name: Invoice Date
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Generated. Invoice Date
data.Description: The date of the invoice, regardless of the date the invoice is created. This is the date from which the due date is calculated based on the invoice terms.

data.Name: Invoice Due Date
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Generated. Invoice Due Date
data.Description: The date payment is due from the customer. Aging of a receivable is usually calculated based on this date.

data.Name: Customer Account ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Generated. Receiving. ADC_ Customer
data.Description: The unique identifier for the receiving customer. Typically autogenerated by the system. Shall match the Customer_Account_ID in the BAS_Customer table.

data.Name: Settlement Method Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Generated. Settlement Method. ADC_ Settlement Method
data.Description: The code value of the method used for cash receipts from customers; for example, check, wire transfer and cash. Shall match the Settlement_Method_Code in the BAS_Settlement_Method table.

data.Name: Invoice Transaction Amount
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Generated. Invoice. Transaction_ Amount
data.Description: The transaction monetary amount recorded in the functional or group currency. No multi-currency translation should be performed on this amount because all transactions are recorded in a single currency.

data.Name: Payment Term Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Generated. Payment Term. ADC_ Payment Term
data.Description: The code of the payment term. Shall match the Payment_Term_Code in the BAS_Payment_Term table; for example, cash on delivery, payment 30 days after delivery date.

data.Name: Terms Discount Percentage
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Generated. Terms Discount. Percentage
data.Description: The discount percentage can be provided if an invoice is paid before a certain number of days. Terms are represented as integers to decimal. EXAMPLE 10% would be represented as 0.10.

data.Name: Terms Discount Days
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Generated. Terms Discount Days. Numeric
data.Description: The number of days from the invoice date that the customer has to take advantage of discounted terms. Terms are represented as integers with no decimal places. EXAMPLE 10 days would be represented as 10.

data.Name: Terms Due Days
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Generated. Terms Due Days. Numeric
data.Description: The number of days allowed that the customer has to meet the obligation before an invoice becomes overdue.
data.XBRLGL: See description for field; explicit in gl-cor:maturityDate

data.Description: The operation records on this record such as create, approve, last modify this record.

data.Name: Grouping Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Generated. Grouping. Code

data.Description: The number of the purchase contract. The number is generated by manual input or is system generated.

data.Name: Contract Type Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Purchase Contract. Contract Type. Name
data.Description: The name of the contract type in purchase activities. EXAMPLE Business agreement, quantity contract, value contract and price contract.

data.Name: Contract Beginning Date
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Purchase Contract. Beginning. Date
data.Description: The beginning date of the contract.

data.Name: Contract Ending Date
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Purchase Contract. Ending. Date
data.Description: The ending date of the contract.

data.Name: Supplier Account ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Purchase Contract. Related. ADC_ Supplier
data.Description: The unique identifier for the supplier account in the purchase contract. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID in the BAS_Supplier table.

data.Name: Purchase Organization Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Purchase Contract. Purchase Organization. ADC_ Business Segment
data.Description: The unique code of the purchase organization which signed the contract. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

data.Name: Purchaser ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Purchase Contract. Purchaser. ADC_ Employee
data.Description: The code of the person who is responsible for purchase contracts. Shall match the Employee_ID in the BAS_Employee table.

data.Name: Settlement Method Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Purchase Contract. Settlement Method. ADC_ Settlement Method
data.Description: The code value or indicator of the method by which the transaction debit or credit amount was settled or apportioned by the customer or the supplier; for example, check, wire transfer and cash. Shall match the Settlement_Method_Code in the BAS_Settlement_Method table.

data.Name: Payment Term Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Purchase Contract. Payment Term. ADC_ Payment Term
data.Description: The code of the payment term; for example, cash on delivery, payment 30 days after delivery date. Shall match the Payment_Term_Code in the BAS_Payment_Term table.

data.Name: Status
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Purchase Contract. Status
data.Description: The status of the purchase contract recorded at the moment. Different ERP vendors have different content for this information output. EXAMPLE New, save, submit, approved and frozen.

data.Name: Remark
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Purchase Contract. Remark
data.Description: Freeform text description.

data.Name: Activity Records
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Purchase Contract. Recorded. ADC_ Activity Records
data.Description: The operation records on this record such as create, approve, last modify this record.
data.XBRLGL: Use corresponding element of XBRL GL taxonomy.

data.Name: Invoice Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Received. Invoice Number. Code
data.Description: The number of the received invoice. The number is usually generated by manual input or system generated; for example, including serial number, document type, and date.

data.Name: Fiscal Period
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Received. Fiscal Year. ADC_ Fiscal Period
data.Description: Accounting period in which the Invoice_Date occurs. The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD in ISO 8601-1. Shall match the Fiscal_Year in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

data.Name: Official Invoice Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Received. Official_ Invoice. Code
data.Description: The unique official code of the invoice, which is usually generated by the tax authorities.

data.Name: Invoice Type Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Received. Invoice Type. Name
data.Description: The name of the invoice type. The invoices are classified according to business content. EXAMPLE Purchase invoice, purchase bill, payable adjustment and other payable.

data.Name: Invoice Date
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Received. Invoice. Date
data.Description: The date of the invoice, regardless of the date the invoice is created. This is the date from which the due date is calculated based on the invoice terms.

data.Name: Invoice Due Date
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Received. Invoice Due. Date
data.Description: The date that payment is due to the supplier. Not all transactions will have a due date; for example, credit memos. Aging of a payable is usually calculated based on this date.

data.Name: Supplier Account ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Received. Related. ADC_ Supplier
data.Description: The unique identifier for the supplier to whom payment is due or from whom unused credits have been applied. Typically autogenerated by the system. Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID in the BAS_Supplier table.

data.Name: Settlement Organization Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Received. Settlement Organization. ADC_ Business Segment
data.Description: The unique code of the settlement organization (Organization of the payment, can be different from the receiving organization). May be the purchase organization or the receipt organization. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

data.Name: Settlement Method Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Received. Settlement Method. ADC_ Settlement Method
data.Description: The code value or indicator of the method by which the transaction debit or credit amount was settled or apportioned by the customer or the supplier; for example, check, wire transfer and cash. Shall match the Settlement_Method_Code in the BAS_Settlement_Method table.

data.Name: Invoice Transaction Amount

data.Description: The transaction monetary amount of an invoice.

data.Name: Payment Term Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Received. Payment Term. ADC_ Payment Term
data.Description: The code of the payment term; for example, cash on delivery, payment 30 days after delivery date. Shall match the Payment_Term_Code in the BAS_Payment_Term table.

data.Name: Terms Discount Percentage
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Received. Terms Discount. Percentage
data.Description: The discount percentage can be provided if an invoice is paid before a certain number of days. In the flat file, terms are represented as integers to decimal. EXAMPLE 10% would be represented as 0.10.

data.Name: Terms Discount Days
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Received. Terms Discount Days. Numeric
data.Description: The number of days from the invoice date the supplier allows customer to take advantage of discounted terms. Terms are represented as integers with no decimal places. EXAMPLE 10 days would be represented as 10.

data.Name: Terms Due Days
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Invoice Received. Terms Due Days. Numeric
data.Description: The number of days allowed that the customer has to meet the obligation before an invoice becomes overdue.
data.XBRLGL: See description for field; explicit in gl-cor:maturityDate

data.Name: Status

data.Description: The status of the inventory document. EXAMPLE New, Save, Submit, Void and Frozen.

data.Name: Inventory Organization Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Inventory Transaction. Inventory Organization. ADC_ Business Segment
data.Description: The code of the inventory organization. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table. Inventory Organization refers to the organizational unit, physical or virtual, where the inventory transaction and balances may be tracked and monitored. It provides inventory information to modules like purchase and sales. The simplest form of inventory organization is warehouse.

data.Name: Inventory Product ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Inventory Transaction. Corresponding. ADC_ Product
data.Description: The unique identifier for the inventory item. Typically autogenerated by the system. Shall match the Inventory_Product_ID in the INV_Product table.

data.Name: Lot Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Inventory Transaction. Lot Number. Code
data.Description: The number associated with a product that is used for tracking and managing the lot.
data.XBRLGL: For XBRL GL, Serial Number and Lot Number are not two separate Boolean fields, but a selection from an enumerated value and an associated freeform field. For lot only, select lot from gl-ehm:serialLotCode (enumerated: serial, lot, other, neither)and leave gl-ehm:serialLotDescription (freeform) blank. For both serial and lot tracked, use other from gl-ehm:serialLotCode and enter SerialAndLot for gl-ehm:serialLotDescription

data.Name: Serial Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Inventory Transaction. Serial Number. Code
data.Description: The number associated with an individual product item that is used for tracking and managing (e.g. a company purchases 10 computers, with each computer assigned an individual serial number).
data.XBRLGL: For XBRL GL, Serial Number and Lot Number are not two separate Boolean fields, but a selection from an enumerated value and an associated freeform field. For serial only, select serial from gl-ehm:serialLotCode (enumerated: serial, lot, other, neither)and leave gl-ehm:serialLotDescription (freeform) blank. For both serial and lot tracked, use other from gl-ehm:serialLotCode and enter SerialAndLot for gl-ehm:serialLotDescription

data.Name: Inventory From Location ID

data.XBRLGL: On negative side of transaction, For XBRL GL, this isn't a single field; use necessary is and Location_ID's XBRL GL concepts to tie back (need to consider interrelationships with other files)

data.Name: Inventory To Location ID

data.Name: Cost Organization Code

Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

data.Name: Inventory Cost

data.Name: inventory System Or External Source

data.Name: inventory Received and Dispatched Flag
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Inventory Transaction. Inventory Received and Dispatched. Indicator

data.Name: Tag Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ PPE Master. Tag Number. Code
data.Description: The tag was commonly used when there was no ERP system to record PPE's state of the whole lifespan. Nowadays, some ERP systems still follow to use it in the business of PPE. The number is usually generated by manual input or system; for example, when there is a PPE, a tag is created correspondingly. And each tag contains either one PPE or several PPEs. However, each PPE has its own PPE_ID as a unique identifier. If a tag only has one PPE, the PPE_ID is the same as the Tag_Number.

data.XBRLGL: gl-taf:originatingDocumentNumber with gl-taf:originatingDocumentType = order-customer * As invoices often reflect shipments and shipments may cross orders, association of each invoice line from the order or shipment associated with the originating order number will appear as an independent entryDetail to differentiate between order lines (with originating order information) and invoice lines (without originating order information, associated by entry header groupings.)

data.Name: Tag Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ PPE Addition. Tag Number. Code
data.Description: The tag was commonly used when there was no ERP system to record PPE's state of the whole lifespan. Nowadays, some ERP systems still follow to use it in the business of PPE. The number is usually generated by manual input or is system generated; for example, when there is a PPE, a tag is created correspondingly. And each tag contains either one PPE or several PPEs. However, each PPE has its own PPE_ID as a unique identifier. If a tag only has one PPE, the PPE_ID is the same as the Tag_Number.

data.Name: Tax Debit GL Account Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Local Tax. Tax Debit GL Account Number. ADC_ Chart Of Accounts
data.Description: The GL account number on which the debit side of the Tax4 transaction has been posted. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.
data.XBRLGL: XBRL GL does not have fields explicitly associating GL accounts to tax, although it does permit specification of accounts as tax accounts (gl-cor:accountPurposeCode); it associates tax detail in the gl-cor:taxes structure with specific accounts by including them within the same gl-cor:entryDetail if the gl-cor:amount is the same, or within the same gl-cor:entryHeader if amounts differ. As with the previous GL lines, the account numbers would be mapped to gl-cor:accountMainID.

data.Description: The GL account number on which the credit side of the Tax transaction has been posted. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

data.XBRLGL: Use corresponding element of XBRL GL taxonomy.

data.Name: Tax Type
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Transaction Tax. Tax Type. ADC_ Tax Type
data.Description: The code of Tax type.
data.XBRLGL: gl-cor:taxCode (Note that XBRL GL permits an unlimited number of tax codes and amounts with the gl-cor:taxes structure.)

data.Name: Tax Amount
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Transaction Tax. Tax. ADC_ Transaction Currency Amount
data.Description: The amount of Tax included in the transaction. Recorded in transac currency.

data.Name: Tax Debit GL Account Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Transaction Tax. Tax Debit GL Account Number. ADC_ Chart Of Accounts
data.Description: The GL account number on which the debit side of the Tax1 transaction has been posted. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.
data.XBRLGL: XBRL GL does not have fields explicitly associating GL accounts to tax, although it does permit specification of accounts as tax accounts (gl-cor:accountPurposeCode); it associates tax detail in the gl-cor:taxes structure with specific accounts by including them within the same gl-cor:entryDetail if the gl-cor:amount is the same, or within the same gl-cor:entryHeader if amounts differ. As with the previous GL lines, the account numbers would be mapped to gl-cor:accountMainID.

data.Name: Tax Credit GL Account Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: ADC_ Transaction Tax. Tax Credit GL Account Number. ADC_ Chart Of Accounts
data.Description: The GL account number on which the credit side of the Tax1 transaction has been posted. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.
